fields.description:
I run Hadoop-0.20 on distributed mode on 10 VMs (NameNode + JobTracker + 8 DataNodes/TaskTrackers) with Mahout trunk.
I tried to test kmeans example with build-reuters.sh but I got an IndexOutOfBoundException when it starts kmeans.
I don't know which operation fails ... ExtractReuters, seqdirectory, seq2sparse or kmeans. Maybe I forgot a configuration ? I searched on the web and didn't find solutions ... 

------------------------ UPDATE == 05/16 -------------------------

Please select a number to choose the corresponding clustering algorithm
1. kmeans clustering
2. lda clustering
Enter your choice : 1
ok. You chose 1 and we'll use kmeans Clustering

comments.body:
Could you retry with the latest from trunk? It looks like the code has been updated from what you are running because line 119 not longer exists in RandomSeedGenerator. I was able to run build-reuters.sh successfully from r1102746.

Are you using one the pre-0.5 releases, or a older snapshot from trunk?

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
I don't have any access to my nodes during week-end, I'll try it monday and I will give you an answer.

The latest svn update I did (I use the svn repository which is indicated in this page : https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAHOUT/BuildingMahout), was on thursday morning.

The difference between lines is probably my fault, I added some display messages to verify variable state during RandomSeedGenerator execution and it is possible that I forgot to delete some lines before I generate this logs.

I'll give you more details monday.

I just update mahout with the latest version (revision 1103636). I tried build-reuters.sh and I get the same Exception (without my changes in RandomSeedGenerator ^^' ), I removed the kmeans folder before svn update. 0.4 release work, so I think my problem isn't caused by my hadoop configuration.

(I edited my first post)

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Allan,

It appears that the problem is due to a change in the behavior of the org.apache.lucene.benchmark.utils.ExtractReuters utility from Lucene that is executed as a part of build-reuters.sh. 

Prior to Lucene 3.1.0 it would extract the Reuters data to the specified output directory, in this case ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out. With the latest version of Lucene, ExtractReuters it appends -tmp on to the directory name, hence the message 

{{Deleting all files in ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/-tmp}}

The next step in build-reuters.sh is to run seqdirectory on ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out, which ends up producing an empty sequence file. You can confirm this by doing:

{{./bin/mahout seqdumper -s examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/chunk-0}}

The result should indicate that this file is empty. The problem isn't caught until the k-means clusterer tries to grab random vectors out of the sequence files generated by seq2sparse, which of course is also empty.

To workaround, try:

{{mv ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/-tmp/* ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ && rmdir ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/-tmp}}

And re-run build-reuters.sh - it should work this time around.

This didn't fail for me initially because I still had a ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out directory containing the dataset around from a previous run.

As an aside, instead of editing your original message, just post the additional details in a follow-up comment. The way JIRA works, it is much easier to track the status of the ticket that way.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris

comments.body:
I cleaned my ./examples/bin/work/ directory and I run the following commands (the beginning of build-reuters.sh) :

$ curl http://kdd.ics.uci.edu/databases/reuters21578/reuters21578.tar.gz  -o work/reuters21578.tar.gz
$ mkdir -p work/reuters-sgm
$ cd work/reuters-sgm && tar xzf ../reuters21578.tar.gz && cd .. && cd ..
$ $MAHOUT_HOME/bin/mahout org.apache.lucene.benchmark.utils.ExtractReuters ./work/reuters-sgm ./work/reuters-out/
$ mv ./reuters-out/-tmp/* ./work/reuters-out/ && rmdir ./work/reuters-out/-tmp
$ $MAHOUT_HOME/bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./work/reuters-out/ -o ./work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5
$ $MAHOUT_HOME/bin/mahout seqdumper -s examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/chunk-0

The last command returned :
Running on hadoop, using HADOOP_HOME=/usr/lib/hadoop-0.20
No HADOOP_CONF_DIR set, using /usr/lib/hadoop-0.20/src/conf 
Input Path: work/reuters-out-seqdir/chunk-0
Key class: class org.apache.hadoop.io.Text Value Class: class org.apache.hadoop.io.Text
Count: 0
11/05/19 10:09:49 INFO driver.MahoutDriver: Program took 274 ms

EDIT : It doesn't have any relation with this post but I also try to find how to format my vector files. Is there any specification somewhere ? For TextFiles, SequenceFiles, SparseSequenceFiles or VectorFile ? I'm looking VectorWritable.java code and Writable.java but a precise specification might be more helpful ...

OK, per Jeff considering this a blocker for the 0.5 release. Let's get a resolution or mitigation as soon as practicable so we can proceed with the release which is otherwise ready to go pending this item.
When I run it, I get the reuters-out created fine (w/ no mods) but still don't get anything useful out of the ClusterDump even though it appears that K-Means is doing a bunch of work.
Ah, I see the -tmp now, it's underneath reuters-out.  Arg.
might simply be handled by dropping the trailing /  on the ExtractReuters command?
In fact, that does the trick.
LUCENE-929 broke this.  The fix for us is to drop the trailing slash for the ExtractReuters command.
Here's the fix.  Allan, please confirm.

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Thanks for taking a look Grant. I suspected I was as simple as slash, but my hadoop cluster wasn't behaving last night in order for me to complete the test.

When running today, it works fine in local mode, but not in distributed mode. In this case, the sequence file in reuters-out-seqdir on hdfs is empty.

I suspect this is because seqdirectory is attempting to find its input on hdfs instead of the local disk. I haven't tested this assumption yet however.

If this were the case, one approach would be to copy the contents of reuters-out up to hdfs when running in distributed mode prior to executing seqdirectory. 

I suspect it is better to force seqdirectory to read off a local disk and write to hdfs. Failing that, force seqdirectory to run in local mode and put the result on to hdfs before executing seq2sparse.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body: Drew, does it even run on a cluster?  I don't see any part that copies the content to HDFS.

comments.body:
your suspicion is correct drew...
0.4 mahout seqdirectory reads from local, but not hdfs 
whereas 0.5 reads from hdfs, but not local

updateAuthor.name: mat_kelcey
updateAuthor.emailAddress: matthew dot kelcey at gmail dot com

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Yes it won't work on a cluster in its current state. The data is never copied from the local disk to hdfs. 

I had the assumption that all of the examples would run in both local and distributed mode, but perhaps build-reuters.sh was never intended do. 

The fix should be fairly straightforward, nevertheless.

I can't recall whether seqdirectory will take a file:/// url in order to pull data from a local disk. I think MAHOUT-700 should make it do so.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
bq. but perhaps build-reuters.sh was never intended do.

I don't think it was given that it would have to do the ExtractReuters step and then copy to HDFS and that has never been in the code.  Besides, Reuters is a pretty small set of data, I don't even know how much it would drive a cluster.

I'm running LDA right now and if it passes, I think I should commit.

author.name: mat_kelcey
author.emailAddress: matthew dot kelcey at gmail dot com

comments.body:
in 0.4 it worked in both local mode and on a cluster and i think all the examples do
agree completely that this case hardly needs a cluster but if in 0.5 it only works in local mode it'll be quite confusing to a new user who tries it with a cluster.
( the reason for failure is far from explicit )

updateAuthor.name: mat_kelcey
updateAuthor.emailAddress: matthew dot kelcey at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Here's the 0.4 code:
{code}
cd examples/bin/
mkdir -p work
if [ ! -e work/reuters-out ]; then
  if [ ! -e work/reuters-sgm ]; then
    if [ ! -f work/reuters21578.tar.gz ]; then
      echo "Downloading Reuters-21578"
      curl http://kdd.ics.uci.edu/databases/reuters21578/reuters21578.tar.gz  -o work/reuters21578.tar.gz
    fi
    mkdir -p work/reuters-sgm
    echo "Extracting..."
    cd work/reuters-sgm && tar xzf ../reuters21578.tar.gz && cd .. && cd ..
  fi
fi

cd ../..
./bin/mahout org.apache.lucene.benchmark.utils.ExtractReuters ./examples/bin/work/reuters-sgm/ ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/
./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5

# to use k-Means clustering, uncomment the next three lines
./bin/mahout seq2sparse -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir-sparse
./bin/mahout kmeans -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir-sparse/tfidf-vectors/ -c ./examples/bin/work/clusters -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-kmeans -x 10 -k 20 -ow
./bin/mahout clusterdump -s examples/bin/work/reuters-kmeans/clusters-10 -d examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir-sparse/dictionary.file-0 -dt sequencefile -b 100 -n 20
{code}

If it worked in 0.4 on a cluster, wouldn't that mean that seqdirectory (SEquenceFilesFromDirectory) read them in from the local filesystem and output it's results to HDFS?  Is that doable in Hadoop, since we don't even pass in URI's when calling this?  If so, what changed for us?  I see there was some refactoring in this area between 0.4 and now, but I certainly don't think this is simply caused by a missing trailing slash.  I don't have handy access to a cluster at the moment.

author.name: mat_kelcey
author.emailAddress: matthew dot kelcey at gmail dot com

comments.body:
there are 2 things; 

firstly
./bin/mahout org.apache.lucene.benchmark.utils.ExtractReuters ./examples/bin/work/reuters-sgm/ ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/
no longer works in 0.5 with the trailing slash, but removing it works

secondly
./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5
in 0.4 reads from local, not hdfs
and 0.5 reads from hdfs, not local

so the second isn't caused the trailing slash, but also not sure what is caused by.

updateAuthor.name: mat_kelcey
updateAuthor.emailAddress: matthew dot kelcey at gmail dot com

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
If we decide that build-reuters.sh should work only in local mode for 0.5, we should explicitly set MAHOUT_LOCAL="true" before calling mahout to force mahout to run in local mode. 

That at least will eliminate any confusion for users who attempt to run the example with HADOOP_HOME and/or HADOOP_CONF set.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Mat Wrote:
{quote}
./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5
in 0.4 reads from local, not hdfs
and 0.5 reads from hdfs, not local
{quote}

Hmm, does setting MAHOUT_LOCAL="true" affect the behavior of seqdirctory wrt to writing to local vs. hdfs?

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
bq. and 0.5 reads from hdfs, not local

Yep, see that now.

But, I presume, in order for it to work in a cluster on 0.4, it then wrote to HDFS.

I agree I think we should support both, so the fix seems to be that if running on a cluster, it needs to copy from local to HDFS first?

I will commit the trailing slash fix.  Can others w/ access to a cluster try to get the other fix on?

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Sure, I will continue to work it. 

I agree, it makes sense to support both distributed and local mode if we can.

I've verified that seqdirectory reads from HDFS regardless of the HADOOP_CONF/HOME/MAHOUT_LOCAL setting, which seems a little odd. I suspect this has something to do with the fact that the mahout driver script is actually calling the hadoop executable, even if I don't really want to explicitly run on a cluster.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body: Close the Input stream.

comments.body:
seems seqdirectory always _reads_ from local but writes depending on MAHOUT_LOCAL (as an env var at least)

# nothing local or hdfs
~/mahout_05$ hadoop fs -ls examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/
ls: Cannot access examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/: No such file or directory.
~/mahout_05$ ls examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/
ls: cannot access examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/: No such file or directory

# run with MAHOUT_LOCAL to prove i'm in cluster mode
~/mahout_05$ unset MAHOUT_LOCAL
~/mahout_05$ ./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5
~/mahout_05$ hadoop fs -ls examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/
Found 1 items
-rw-r--r--   1 hadoop supergroup         78 2011-05-20 20:24 /user/hadoop/examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/chunk-0

~/mahout_05$ hadoop fs -rmr examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir/

# run with local
~/mahout_05$ MAHOUT_LOCAL=true ./bin/mahout seqdirectory -i ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out/ -o ./examples/bin/work/reuters-out-seqdir -c UTF-8 -chunk 5

chunk-0  chunk-1  chunk-2

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Updated build-reuters.sh to be a bit more sane about its working directory, sensitive to whether mahout will execute in local or distributed mode and to reuse the reuters-reuters-sgm, reuters-out and reuters-out-seqdir directories if they already exist.

Work is done in a directory called mahout-work, seqdirectory is always run locally, and if in distributed mode, the result are copied up to hdfs. 

Also updated output of lda and kmeans so that their directory names do not overlap.

This could do a better job of cleaning up before/after it executes, but it gets the job done.

Please take a look and give this a try, I've run kmeans in local and distributed mode (forcing local by unsetting HADOOP_HOME), I am running lda in distributed mode now, but my cluster is small and it takes a long time to complete.

updateAuthor.name: drew.farris
updateAuthor.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

comments.body: If we commit this, do you all think this is about right such that we can continue with the release?
I'm reviewing at the moment, but yeah, if it works, I see no reason not to continue.
Hmm, Drew, I don't see the ClusterDump output after running this in local mode.
But, I ran it a second time and then I got results.  Weird.

bq. Work is done in a directory called mahout-work, seqdirectory is always run locally, and if in distributed mode, the result are copied up to hdfs. 

Just curious, why the need to change from work to mahout-work?
Not sure what happened, ran again after clearing out mahout-work and it worked.
Drew, +1 on committing.

author.name: drew.farris
author.emailAddress: drew dot farris at gmail dot com

I updated my mahout trunk this morning, cleaned my ./examples/bin/work directory and applied MAHOUT-694.patch on build-reuters.sh. It perfectly works :) . Thank you for your help.

All I need now is to find how I can create my vector files to use kmeans.
Superb, may I/we commit and then continue with the release? Not trying to rush anything delicate here, but also wanting to make sure I push through to finish the process as soon as we're able.

* /mahout/trunk/examples/bin/build-reuters.sh
